page.title: 19CUB SCOUTS
page.content: On Wednesday nights boys between 7 and 11 years can go to Cubs.There is a uniform which is a green jumper and cap, a yellow scarf and a woggle, a plastic ring that keeps the scarf to- gether round the neck. The sub is 20p a week which helps to pay for some of the things they do. There are several groups in the pack and each has a 'sixer' who leads the group and a 'seconder' to help him. The pack leader begins the evening with a grand howl and everyone salutes the Union Jack and promises to be good Cub Scouts. In the summer the pack then play a game outside before they start working for badges. The badges are for example, artist, home help, swimming, writer's, book reader etc: At the end of the evening the flag is lowered and the Cubs go home.
